column1: Urziceni (Romanian pronunciation: [urziˈt͡ʃenʲ]) is a city in Ialomița County
column4: located around 60 km north-east of Bucharest. It has a population of 14

column1: As the census of 2011 results shows
column2: Urziceni is ranked in 3rd place in Ialomița County
column3: after Slobozia and Fetești with 14053 stable residents

column2: its name is derived from the word "urzică" (nettle). It was mentioned for the first time in a written document on 23 April 1596
column3: during the reign of Mihai Viteazul. It gained in 1831 the status of market town and in 1895 the city status. For 117 years
column4: it was the capital of Ialomița County (between 1716 and 1833).

column1: A little town by any standards
column2: Urziceni is perhaps best known for its football team
column3: Unirea Urziceni. Urziceni holds the record for the smallest town to have a team in the Champions League after Fontvieille
column4: hometown of AS Monaco FC. The team wound up a year later.
